page.title: 10BADGERS AND OTHER MAMMALS.
page.content: Badgers are very common in our area, the average distance between social groups being less than 1km.There is ample evidence of badger presence with "up and overs"seen in most hedges.In our block, the north-east section showed the most ideal habitat and badger concentrations were greatest here with setts well below the average distance apart. The farmland here is not intensively cultivated and the badgers are rarely disturbed.Most of the fourteen setts we found were in scrubland,on a slope,close to pasture land with a stream nearby. Other mammals found in the area were:- foxes,rabbits,field mice,house mice, moles,hedgehogs,shrews,deer (1 specimen),stoats,mink,bats,rats,grey squirrels,weasels,voles and otters.
